channel.title: Gpu on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Gpu on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: Optical Character Recognition with parallel computing?
item.description: Some references to collect here on the use of general-purpose graphic processors in OCR.  Nominally, you run some kind of MapReduce based algorithm with a GPGPU over some image, and out spits text much faster than any ordinary processor of any speed; of course, there are lots of details to attend to. From Berkeley EECS: Algorithms and Frameworks for OCR and Content-based Image Retrieval Jike Chong, Bryan Christopher Catanzaro, Narayanan Sundaram, Fares Hedayati and Kurt Keutzer
